DOCNAME: CASE OF LARISA ZOLOTAREVA v. RUSSIA
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Julia Laffranque;Khanlar Hajiyev;Linos-Alexandre Sicilianos
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicant resided in a municipal CARDINAL - roomed flat together with her son , his ex - wife PERSON and their daughter , a minor at the time . On an unspecified date the applicant brought a claim against PERSON seeking PERSON ’s eviction . PERSON countersued the applicant asking the court to rehouse everyone . PERSON alleged that the applicant and her son had forced her to move out of the flat and their joint residence in the same flat had become impossible .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of GPE dismissed the applicant ’s claims and granted PERSON ’s claim . It ordered the applicant and her son to be rehoused in another CARDINAL - room flat . At the same time PERSON and her daughter were granted a room in another building . The flat the applicant resided in was assigned to another family . In particular , the court noted as follows :

“ Pursuant to LAW of the [ LAW ] , if the members of a family fail to reach an agreement with regard to re - housing , any of them may ask for the re - housing arrangements to be determined by the court . The court must take into consideration the relevant circumstances and the interests of the persons to be re - housed .

The court asked repeatedly that [ the applicant and her son ] justify their objection to the re - housing arrangement [ proposed by PERSON ] . However , they did not present any written submissions ... and refused to give any [ oral ] explanation or answer any questions during the court hearing ...
The witnesses testified that the parties were in conflict and provided details as to the altercations between [ them ] ...
The existence of a conflict between the parties is also confirmed by the numerous complaints they have lodged against each other with the law - enforcement agencies ...

Having regard to the above , the court concludes that the parties can not share the flat in question . PERSON and her daughter are unable to reside in the flat , which fact amounts to a violation of their housing rights ...

Pursuant to LAW ] , PERSON can not be evicted from the flat . It was established that [ the applicant and her family ] had consented to PERSON moving into the flat . PERSON had moved into the flat and , as set forth in Articles CARDINAL and DATE of the [ Housing Code ] , she had acquired a right to reside in there .
The court has established that it was impossible for the parties to share the flat due to their own behaviour ... The conflicts between the parties underlie the housing dispute between them .
The court further considers that PERSON ’s eviction , if ordered , would have an adverse effect on the housing rights of her daughter , who lives with her .
According to ORG , she asked for re - housing for the first time in DATE . However , [ the applicant and her son ] did not consent to it .

PERSON proposed the following re - housing arrangement : [ the applicant and her son ] would move into a CARDINAL - room flat ... In the flat in dispute each resident party had been afforded CARDINAL sq . m of the living area ... Following the re - housing , [ the applicant and her son ] would be afforded CARDINAL sq . m of the living area each ... The CARDINAL would have separate rooms . The flat is located in [ GPE ] ...
The court does not discern any reason why the proposed re - housing arrangement should not be implemented ... ”
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG concurred with the assessment of the matter made by ORG and upheld the judgment of CARDINAL DATE on appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff initiated enforcement proceedings .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant asked for supervisory review of the judgments of CARDINAL May and DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE asked ORG to forward the case - file for supervisory review . As regards the applicant ’s eviction , the judge in charge of the matter noted that the execution of the judgment of CARDINAL DATE “ should be stayed ” .
CARDINAL . On DATE a bailiff , P. , called at the applicant ’s flat and told her that she would be evicted DATE . As regards the stay of execution , he advised her to contact the court .

CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff showed up at the applicant ’s flat at CARDINAL a.m. The applicant refused to open the door . The bailiff had to leave . He returned with the rescue service at TIME The applicant was not in the flat . The bailiff entered the flat . The applicant returned TIME . She claimed that she did not feel well and was undergoing treatment in a hospital . The bailiff left .

CARDINAL . After having verified that the applicant had not been admitted to any hospital , the bailiff forced open the door to the flat at TIME and started the eviction process . According to the applicant , the bailiff summoned police officers , who took her to the police station where she stayed for TIME . The bailiff completed the eviction at TIME Some of the applicant ’s belongings were moved to her new home and the remainder were left at the flat .
CARDINAL . On DATE , in the applicant ’s absence , the bailiff moved the rest of her belongings to her new home .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of the Russian Federation refused to review the judgments of CARDINAL May and DATE by way of supervisory review . In particular , the letter addressed to the applicant stated as follows :

“ I hereby inform you that your complaint against the judgment of ORG of CARDINAL DATE concerning your claims against PERSON ... has been considered and dismissed . The grounds for dismissal have been communicated to you earlier at a meeting . ”
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint against the bailiff , challenging the manner in which he had conducted her eviction .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of GPE found the bailiff ’s actions unlawful and ordered him to provide the applicant with an access to her belongings stored at her new home . In particular , the court found as follows :

“ The court established that bailiff PERSON conducted enforcement proceedings after CARDINAL p.m. although there was no imminent risk to anyone ’s life or health ... This fact was not denied by the representative of the [ bailiff ’s service ] . Nor was evidence presented to the court that [ the bailiff ] had obtained a written approval from a senior bailiff to carry out the enforcement proceedings after TIME

As it has been established by the court , [ the applicant ] had asked the bailiff to suspend the enforcement proceedings arguing that she was not feeling well and her son [ who had been subject to eviction too ] had been absent . PERSON to do so , alleging that [ such a suspension ] was exclusively within a court ’s competence .
Nevertheless , Article CARDINAL of LAW provides that bailiffs may suspend enforcement proceedings ... for a period not exceeding DATE ...

The [ bailiff ’s service ] failed to prove that the bailiff had notified [ the applicant and her son ] of the possibility of voluntary execution of the judgment concerning their eviction . Nor was any evidence submitted to show that the applicant ’s son had been notified of the eviction date . The list of the [ applicant ’s ] possessions was not properly compiled . This fact was not denied by the [ bailiff ’s service ] ...

The court has established that the case concerning the [ applicant ’s ] eviction was repeatedly subject to supervisory review . On DATE the Deputy President of ORG , Zh . , requested the file and the execution of the judgment was stayed . ORG of GPE dismissed the [ applicant ’s ] complaint only on DATE . Accordingly , the enforcement of the judgment had been stayed until DATE ...

However , bailiff PERSON failed to stay the enforcement proceedings following ORG decision to stay the execution of the judgment . Accordingly , the [ applicant ’s ] eviction was carried out during the period when the execution of the judgment had been stayed by the Deputy President of ORG .
Having regard to the above , the court concludes that the actions taken by bailiff PERSON should be found unlawful . ”
CARDINAL . The decision was not appealed against and took effect on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant brought an action against ORG of GPE for damages resulting from the bailiff ’s unlawful actions . She sought compensation for both pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE rejected the applicant ’s claims . In particular , the court stated as follows :
“ Pursuant to [ the rules of civil procedure ] , each party should [ substantiate its allegations ] ...
[ The applicant ] did not present to the court any evidence to show that her property had been damaged or destroyed as a result of illegal actions taken by [ the bailiff ] .
As indicated on [ the certificate of the delivery to the applicant of her belongings ] , she did not make any comment or complain with regard to the delivery of her property .
No damage or destruction of the [ applicant ’s ] property has been documented after the applicant ’s re - housing on DATE ...
Having regard to the above , the court considers that the damage to and destruction of the [ applicant ’s ] property was not a result of illegal actions on the part of the bailiff ...

Accordingly , there is no causal link between the bailiff ’s illegal actions and the harm caused to the applicant ’s property ... and there is , accordingly , no reason to award damages to the applicant ...

The applicant did not present any evidence to substantiate her allegations that she had incurred non - pecuniary damage as a result of the infringement of her personal non - property rights ... through the illegal actions of the bailiff in the course of the eviction on DATE . ”
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of DATE on appeal .

CARDINAL . Enforcement proceedings should be conducted on DATE TIME can be carried out between TIME and TIME only in the event of an “ imminent risk to life or health ” . In such a case , the bailiff should obtain written permission from his superior ( LAW of LAW on enforcement proceedings of DATE as amended , in force at the material time , hereinafter “ the Law ” ) .
CARDINAL . NORP The bailiff may suspend the enforcement proceedings for DATE at the debtor ’s request ( LAW of the PERSON ) .
CARDINAL . The enforcement proceedings should be stayed if an authorised officer issues a relevant decision ordering the stay of the execution of the relevant legal act ( LAW ) .
